722693f-a.text:
Ridge Street, north from Rivington, to East Houston Street's, showing details and activities of th4s East Side thoroughfare. Populated by immigrants, their needs are served by the pushcart market at the curb. Note the street car tracks in the center. These, obviously are
for horse drawn cars.
About 1905
Brown Bros., photographers
N g 2609
722693f-a.folder: Ridge Street & Rivington Street, Manhattan, NY

722989f-a.text:
194-182 Rivington Street, adjoining and west of the N.W. corner of Ridge Street. No. 192 is a frame house with a brick front.
1932.
J. Clarence Davies Collection, Museum of the City of New York.
Negative No. 306.
